author: Sharkey

review: The concept is great but more apps are needed like pandora, tune-in, etc. Also, you can chromecast web pages but not all video will show up.If you have an older tv with an HDMI input it is a no-brainer as you can make such tv's "smart" (albeit with access right now only to netflix, google music, you tube).  You do need a power source for it, though.  Only the newer tvs have powered hdmi or powered usb (you can plug the unit into an outlet or a powered usb port for power).The other thing that would be nice is if they allow you to play content from a local, networked library (support for MX Player would be awesome).
author: Amazon Customer

review: Bought it because I thought I can look at stuff on my iPad and for presentation at work on our large screen monitor.  This unit is NOT useful for iPad.  The only thing you can use it for is to display youTube and Netflix, both available though a blu-ray player or smart TV, and not very useful at work.  So it's pretty much useless for iPad.For those who dosen't know how it works, I believe it rebroadcasts certain sites (currently 2 sites) from Google.This is an emerging technology so it will probably get better in time. But for now, it's a waste of money for iPad users.If you keep the unit plugged up all the time, it gets really hot.Apple needs to develop a bluetooth or wireless HDMI interface for iPad.  Would be really useful for me.
author: James J. Trivitayakhun

review: While this is a "Beta" product it is very promising.Easy to set up and use, reduces the need for a smart TV by actually acting as one by transforming a regular TV to a "Smart TV".There are some bugs and I am guessing they will be fixed, nothing that can't be worked around

review: I was hoping that the player will be able to replace my WD TV Live, but I might have to wait till Google allows streaming from the local network shares (that was possible in the beginning, but not anymore). Since I'm not Netflix subscriber and don't watch Hulu the functionality of Cromecast is limited to watching Youtube (which works very well) and streaming from the Chrome browser. So far WD TV Live does much better job for me. I hope the Google changes their policy and will extend the applications list.
